summary: The COVID Fraud Transparency Act of 2025 mandates the Inspector General of the Small Business Administration to submit quarterly reports to the House and Senate Small Business Committees. These reports detail fraud related to COVID-19 loans, including the number of borrowers engaged in fraud, new and resolved fraud cases, and the types of fraud. The Act covers loans made under specific sections of the Small Business Act during the COVID-19 period, as defined by the CARES Act. The Act will terminate two years after its enactment. It also states that no additional funds are authorized to carry out this Act.
